meanings.definition: To explain something in excessive detail or to an unnecessary extent.
meanings.sent1: She kept overexplaining the math problem until everyone was confused.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overexplain simple tasks, making them seem more complicated.
meanings.sent3: The robot started overexplaining how to make a sandwich, causing laughter among the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her words overexplained the concept, drowning out the main point.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's overexplaining left the students feeling overwhelmed and lost.

meanings.definition: The act of providing more information or clarification than is needed.
meanings.sent1: His constant overexplaining of every detail made the meeting drag on.
meanings.sent2: The overexplaining in the manual made it difficult to find the essential steps.
meanings.sent3: The overexplaining in the presentation led to some eye rolls from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The overexplaining of the rules only served to confuse the players further.
meanings.sent5: The overexplaining of the safety procedures made the training session feel never-ending.
